Find and Kill JMX Port Process | Generated by AI

Home 2025.10

Got it ‚Äî you want to check which Java program on Windows has opened a JMX remote agent on port 9091, and then kill it if necessary. Here‚Äôs how you can do it step by step:

1. Find the Process Using Port 9091

Open Command Prompt (as Administrator if possible), and run:

netstat -ano | findstr :9091

This shows something like:

  TCP    0.0.0.0:9091    0.0.0.0:0    LISTENING    12345
  • The last column (12345 here) is the PID (Process ID).

2. Identify Which Program That PID Belongs To

Now map the PID to the actual program:

tasklist /FI "PID eq 12345"

This will show something like:

Image Name                     PID   Session Name        Mem Usage
========================= ======== ================ ============
java.exe                    12345 Console           200,000 K

If it‚Äôs a Java process, you can get even more detail:

wmic process where processid=12345 get CommandLine

That prints the command line used to launch the JVM ‚Äî you‚Äôll see the JMX flags (-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.port=9091), which confirms it‚Äôs the JMX remote agent.

3. Kill the Process

If you‚Äôve confirmed it‚Äôs safe to stop, you can kill it:

taskkill /PID 12345 /F
  • /PID specifies the process ID.
  • /F forces termination.

4. Alternative with PowerShell

If you prefer PowerShell, you can run:

Get-Process -Id (Get-NetTCPConnection -LocalPort 9091).OwningProcess

To kill directly:

Stop-Process -Id (Get-NetTCPConnection -LocalPort 9091).OwningProcess -Force

üîé Summary:

  1. netstat -ano | findstr :9091 ‚Üí get PID
  2. tasklist /FI "PID eq <PID>" ‚Üí see which program
  3. wmic process where processid=<PID> get CommandLine ‚Üí see JVM flags
  4. taskkill /PID <PID> /F ‚Üí kill
